alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester; Northwest Middlesex County; Southern Worcester; Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 2:26PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...SOME SLIPPERY TRAVEL THROUGH THE EVENING COMMUTE ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS... Light to moderate snow will continue this afternoon across central and western MA, northern CT and portions of northwest RI. Accumulations will vary by elevation with 1 to 2 inches across lower elevations, while 2 to 4 inches is expected at elevations above 800 feet. Roads will be snow covered and slippery in the higher elevations with some impact to the evening commute. Mainly wet roads are expected in the lower elevations but roads may become coated by late afternoon as the sun goes down. The snow will taper off this evening from west to east. Motorists should use caution if traveling this afternoon and evening as some roads will be snow covered and slippery.
